HDG.LOG.content: [lays what is present before into presence] > all disclosure releases (Entbergen enthebt) what is present from concealment [Lacan, return of repressed] > forgetting as a reservoir to draw from [aletheia, trace]
HDG.LOG.linkedContent: [lays what is present before into presence] > all disclosure releases (Entbergen enthebt) what is present from concealment [Lacan, return of repressed] > forgetting as a reservoir to draw from [aletheia, trace]

HDG.BC.content: Being as most worn-out coin (abgegriffenste Münze), what is most self-understood, that which we constantly pay for every relation to beings: Being, most worn-out, most indifferent > even when we want Nothing, Being remains, resists expenditure/consumption > in extremity of desired annihilation of all beings, Being must appear [cf. Open Manifest, total annihilation? Being makes annihilation of beings possible]

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

HDG.BC.linkedContent: Being as most worn-out coin (abgegriffenste Münze), what is most self-understood, that which we constantly pay for every relation to beings: Being, most worn-out, most indifferent > even when we want Nothing, Being remains, resists expenditure/consumption > in extremity of desired annihilation of all beings, Being must appear [cf. Open Manifest, total annihilation? Being makes annihilation of beings possible]

HDG.BC.content: Being like the fleeting cloud of a shadow, like that which doesn’t effect (bewirken) anything or leave behind a trace (Spur) [khōra]
HDG.BC.linkedContent: Being like the fleeting cloud of a shadow, like that which doesn’t effect (bewirken) anything or leave behind a trace (Spur) [khōra]

HDG.BC.content: [indifference point not dialectical sublation] Hegel could never say “Actuality” and nothing are the same, though he does realize both are most extreme abstractions of “actuality” > attend to the following only in passing [?]: Nothing presences, not the nullity people apply to it > when Nothing rests on fancy, mere play of understanding, the emptiest & the unique [just like Being] > Nothing not a nullity (for us): horror towards devastation, recoiling in terror of annihilation: shrinking back from something that can’t be addressed as mere imagination or something baseless
HDG.BC.linkedContent: [indifference point not dialectical sublation] Hegel could never say “Actuality” and nothing are the same, though he does realize both are most extreme abstractions of “actuality” > attend to the following only in passing [?]: Nothing presences, not the nullity people apply to it > when Nothing rests on fancy, mere play of understanding, the emptiest & the unique [just like Being] > Nothing not a nullity (for us): horror towards devastation, recoiling in terror of annihilation: shrinking back from something that can’t be addressed as mere imagination or something baseless

HDG.BC.content: what if Nothing is same as Being? Being something horrifying/dreadful, something that assails us [annihilation of trace?] > [is this why we become indifferent to Being, why we flee to reassurance via the “self-understood”? Mitsein]
HDG.BC.linkedContent: what if Nothing is same as Being? Being something horrifying/dreadful, something that assails us [annihilation of trace?] > [is this why we become indifferent to Being, why we flee to reassurance via the “self-understood”? Mitsein]

HDG.BC.content: no trace of intention not to say Being [for you either???], so keeping silent comes from Being itself (word arises from realm of silence)

motif.name: UNSCATHED / SAFE / SACRED / GUARD / SECURITY / KEEP
motif.title: UNSCATHED / SAFE / SACRED / GUARD / SECURITY / KEEP

HDG.BC.linkedContent: no trace of intention not to say Being [for you either???], so keeping silent comes from Being itself (word arises from realm of silence)

HDG.BC.content: [alibis] “have done (fertig)” w/ Being by appealing to this/that being (avoid abode [of Being]) > abode (Aufenhaltes) [of Being] contains an exacting expectation (Zumutung), demand to experience abode of historical man, originates from claim of Being itself, claim comes from still-concealed essence of history > a strange demand, don’t minimize [lose hold] of this strangeness (Befremdlichkeit), we need history itself to make us remember, give us hints for reflection, a reflection that grants us remembrance of 1st inception of Western thought [strangeness as trace] > why is that? only inception itself can tell us [heterotautology?]
HDG.BC.linkedContent: [alibis] “have done (fertig)” w/ Being by appealing to this/that being (avoid abode [of Being]) > abode (Aufenhaltes) [of Being] contains an exacting expectation (Zumutung), demand to experience abode of historical man, originates from claim of Being itself, claim comes from still-concealed essence of history > a strange demand, don’t minimize [lose hold] of this strangeness (Befremdlichkeit), we need history itself to make us remember, give us hints for reflection, a reflection that grants us remembrance of 1st inception of Western thought [strangeness as trace] > why is that? only inception itself can tell us [heterotautology?]

HDG.TB.content: our task: trace Being to its own from Appropriation (w/out regard to relation of Being to beings) [beyond ontological difference? beyond metaphysics?], think Being w/ out regard to metaphysics > but regard for metaphysics still prevails, thus our task is to cease all overcoming [of metaphysics], leave metaphysics to itself

motif.name: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY
motif.title: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY

HDG.TB.linkedContent: our task: trace Being to its own from Appropriation (w/out regard to relation of Being to beings) [beyond ontological difference? beyond metaphysics?], think Being w/ out regard to metaphysics > but regard for metaphysics still prevails, thus our task is to cease all overcoming [of metaphysics], leave metaphysics to itself

HDG.WM.content: no annihilation (Vernichtung) of whole of beings takes place in anxiety > nothing doesn’t attract, essentially repelling (abweisend) > nothing itself nihilates (das Nichts selbst nichtet), grants the nothing, not submitted to calculation of annihilation or negation (Verneinung) > nihilation manifests beings in heretofore concealed strangeness as what is radically other (schlechthin Andere) [totally other] re: nothing > originally nihilating nothing brings Dasein, for 1st time, before beings as such—in anxiety original openness of Being

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

motif.name: DERRIDA CONFESSES, SUMMARIZES in "Punctuations: the Time of a Thesis"
motif.title: DERRIDA CONFESSES, SUMMARIZES in "Punctuations: the Time of a Thesis"

HDG.WM.linkedContent: no annihilation (Vernichtung) of whole of beings takes place in anxiety > nothing doesn’t attract, essentially repelling (abweisend) > nothing itself nihilates (das Nichts selbst nichtet), grants the nothing, not submitted to calculation of annihilation or negation (Verneinung) > nihilation manifests beings in heretofore concealed strangeness as what is radically other (schlechthin Andere) [totally other] re: nothing > originally nihilating nothing brings Dasein, for 1st time, before beings as such—in anxiety original openness of Being

HDG.WM.content: turn away from nothing into beings: hasten into public superficies of our existence > what testifies (zeugt) to manifestation (Offenbarkeit) of nothing in our existence more than negation? > “not (das Nicht)” more original [?] than negation, negating only one way of nihilating (one way of comporting grounded beforehand in in nihilation of nothing) [annihilation is another way?] > “not” becomes manifest only when nihilation of nothing disengaged from concealment: idea of “logic” disintegrates in turbulence of more originary questioning [has this been proven?]
HDG.WM.linkedContent: turn away from nothing into beings: hasten into public superficies of our existence > what testifies (zeugt) to manifestation (Offenbarkeit) of nothing in our existence more than negation? > “not (das Nicht)” more original [?] than negation, negating only one way of nihilating (one way of comporting grounded beforehand in in nihilation of nothing) [annihilation is another way?] > “not” becomes manifest only when nihilation of nothing disengaged from concealment: idea of “logic” disintegrates in turbulence of more originary questioning [has this been proven?]

HDG.QB.content: essence of human being, “Dasein in human being,” is nothing human [the trace, totally other] > when the idea of human essence grounds everything present (i.e. human authoritative, underlying ground): secures beings in their being, (human essence is the presence that first) permits “representation”

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

HDG.QB.linkedContent: essence of human being, “Dasein in human being,” is nothing human [the trace, totally other] > when the idea of human essence grounds everything present (i.e. human authoritative, underlying ground): secures beings in their being, (human essence is the presence that first) permits “representation”

HDG.QB.content: nothing, which as absence interrupts (Abbruch) (“nullifies [nichtet]”) presence, w/out ever annihilating it > insofar as nothing “nullifies,” it confirms itself as a distinctive presence, veiling itself as such presence
HDG.QB.linkedContent: nothing, which as absence interrupts (Abbruch) (“nullifies [nichtet]”) presence, w/out ever annihilating it > insofar as nothing “nullifies,” it confirms itself as a distinctive presence, veiling itself as such presence

HDG.QB.content: [Heidegger’s method as Destruction then building (for dwelling)?] build path (Weg) leads back to locality (Ortschaft) of recovery (Verwindung) of metaphysics to let us journey through what is destined in overcoming (Überwindung) nihilism [not there yet, narrative yet to come] > despite rejection of text for publication [annihilation of trace], he who learns must examine more originarily, w/ greater care, the saying of reflective thinking, might leave such saying in realm of mystery one day, as highest gift (höchstes Geschenk) & greatest danger [beyond Being, the worst, totally other, risk annihilation?]

motif.title: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY

HDG.CCP.content: as release from transcendental re-presentation, Gelassenheit is a relinquishing of the willing of a horizon > this relinquishing doesn’t stem from a willing, except the occasion for releasing oneself to Gegnet “requires a trace of willing” > this trace vanishes while releasing oneself & is completely extinguished in Gelassenheit [annihilation of trace or absolute ash?]
HDG.CCP.linkedContent: as release from transcendental re-presentation, Gelassenheit is a relinquishing of the willing of a horizon > this relinquishing doesn’t stem from a willing, except the occasion for releasing oneself to Gegnet “requires a trace of willing” > this trace vanishes while releasing oneself & is completely extinguished in Gelassenheit [annihilation of trace or absolute ash?]

HDG.DL.content: Winke brauchen den weitesten Schwingungsbereich [hints, traces, need/use the widest swinging realm], where mortals go back-forth slowly, “hesitate (zögern),” done truly when slowness (Langsame) rests (getragen) on shy reverence (die Scheu)
HDG.DL.linkedContent: Winke brauchen den weitesten Schwingungsbereich [hints, traces, need/use the widest swinging realm], where mortals go back-forth slowly, “hesitate (zögern),” done truly when slowness (Langsame) rests (getragen) on shy reverence (die Scheu)

HDG.DL.content: Die Achtsamkeit auf die Spuren, die das Denken in seinen Quellbereich weisen [give heed to trails (traces) that direct thinking back to region of its source] [for Derrida the traces are the source in such a way that there is no source to think back to] > do you find these traces? > I find them because they’re not of my making (stammen), because they’re rarely discernible, like the wind-borne echo of a distant call (fernen Zurufes) [annihilation of trace]

motif.title: DERRIDA CONFESSES, SUMMARIZES in "Punctuations: the Time of a Thesis"

motif.title: PREORGINARY SYNTHESIS [Derrida bringing together instead of dividing?]

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

HDG.DL.linkedContent: Die Achtsamkeit auf die Spuren, die das Denken in seinen Quellbereich weisen [give heed to trails (traces) that direct thinking back to region of its source] [for Derrida the traces are the source in such a way that there is no source to think back to] > do you find these traces? > I find them because they’re not of my making (stammen), because they’re rarely discernible, like the wind-borne echo of a distant call (fernen Zurufes) [annihilation of trace]

HDG.DL.content: thinking look (Anleitung) into Sage only beginning of path that takes us back out (zürucknimmt) of metaphysical representations in das Achten auf die Winke jener Botschaft, deren Botengänger wir eigens werden möchten [in the attention/heeding of hints, traces, whose message we would want to properly bear?]
HDG.DL.linkedContent: thinking look (Anleitung) into Sage only beginning of path that takes us back out (zürucknimmt) of metaphysical representations in das Achten auf die Winke jener Botschaft, deren Botengänger wir eigens werden möchten [in the attention/heeding of hints, traces, whose message we would want to properly bear?]

HDG.DL.content: are we not attempting the impossible (Unmögliche)? Allerdings — solange dem Menschen nicht jener Botengang rein gewährt ist , den die Botschaft braucht, die dem Menschen die Entbergung der Zwiefalt zuspricht [basically he says: so long as we have not been given the pure gift of messaging to course through the usage of message that grants us the unconcealment of the two-fold] > veiled relation (Verhältnis) btwn message & messenger’s course plays (spielt) everywhere [play of the trace]
HDG.DL.linkedContent: are we not attempting the impossible (Unmögliche)? Allerdings — solange dem Menschen nicht jener Botengang rein gewährt ist , den die Botschaft braucht, die dem Menschen die Entbergung der Zwiefalt zuspricht [basically he says: so long as we have not been given the pure gift of messaging to course through the usage of message that grants us the unconcealment of the two-fold] > veiled relation (Verhältnis) btwn message & messenger’s course plays (spielt) everywhere [play of the trace]

HDG.LP.content: re: stranger, all who come from the decomposed kind (verwesende Geschlechtes) are others > stranger (Fremdling): “He yonder,” the one who is apart (Ab-geschiedene) > strange thing (Fremdes) called to lose itself, to go under, but that does not mean it’s annihilated (Vernichtung) [or crumbles into shambles]

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

HDG.LP.linkedContent: re: stranger, all who come from the decomposed kind (verwesende Geschlechtes) are others > stranger (Fremdling): “He yonder,” the one who is apart (Ab-geschiedene) > strange thing (Fremdes) called to lose itself, to go under, but that does not mean it’s annihilated (Vernichtung) [or crumbles into shambles]

HDG.WL.content: in the Erläuterung des Sprachwesens as Saying (Sage), our way to language has reached its goal (Ziel), reached language as such [arrival] [so it seems] > in truth, our reflection has only come w/in sight of Weg zur Sprache it is seeking, is barely on its traces (Spur)

motif.name: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE
motif.title: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE

HDG.WL.linkedContent: in the Erläuterung des Sprachwesens as Saying (Sage), our way to language has reached its goal (Ziel), reached language as such [arrival] [so it seems] > in truth, our reflection has only come w/in sight of Weg zur Sprache it is seeking, is barely on its traces (Spur)

HDG.WL.content: [method of arrival, in the instant?] we need a plain, sudden, unforgettable thus forever new look (Blick) into something we don’t even try to know > the quick and stirring regsames Erregende) of Saying: earliest/most ancient at once, region of all places, first break of dawn for all that is present/absent, that which makes the cycle of day/night possible: Das Regende im Zeigen der Sage ist das Eignen ——Eignen (Owning) that moves Saying as Showing is Ereignis, yields (er-gibt) opening of the clearing, in which present beings can persist (anwähren) & absent beings can depart, while keeping (behalten) their persistence (Währen) in withdrawal (im Entzug) [cf. erasure of trace] > das Ereignende [what is yielding] ist das Ereignis selbst—nothing else > Ereignis can’t be represented as occurrence (Vorkommnis) or happening (Geschehen), “can only be experienced as abiding gift yielded (Gewährende) by saying” > Ereignis is not the result of something, but the giving yield (Er-gebnis), whose giving along gives us Es gibt, to which even Being needs to come [so to come] into its own as presence (um als Anwesen in sein Eigenes zu gelangen)

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

HDG.TC.content: discovery of technology unleashed powers of nature as process of annihilation encompassing earth
HDG.TC.linkedContent: discovery of technology unleashed powers of nature as process of annihilation encompassing earth

HDG.TC.content: deliberately speaking of annihilation (Vernichtung), not just destruction (Zerstörung): annihilation is the more encompassing (umfassendere) destruction (also takes into account destruction of countless lives) > can only speak of annihilation by intimations (Andeutungen), point away from what is not meant > annihilation not the highest grade of destruction but essentially other (wesenhaft anderes) than destruction > always something left over w/ destruction, no “remainderless (restlose)” destruction > there is no annihilation at all: the destruction where nothing left remaining, this remainder (Übrig) is nothing: has consumed (aufgezehrt) every “is” & itself > from destruction to annihilation, a change of condition, leap into another essence > not only nothing still left remaining in annihilation, but something, and only, of its own arises (entsteht)

motif.name: SACRIFICE [to define, philosophy of life required]
motif.title: SACRIFICE [to define, philosophy of life required]

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

HDG.TC.linkedContent: deliberately speaking of annihilation (Vernichtung), not just destruction (Zerstörung): annihilation is the more encompassing (umfassendere) destruction (also takes into account destruction of countless lives) > can only speak of annihilation by intimations (Andeutungen), point away from what is not meant > annihilation not the highest grade of destruction but essentially other (wesenhaft anderes) than destruction > always something left over w/ destruction, no “remainderless (restlose)” destruction > there is no annihilation at all: the destruction where nothing left remaining, this remainder (Übrig) is nothing: has consumed (aufgezehrt) every “is” & itself > from destruction to annihilation, a change of condition, leap into another essence > not only nothing still left remaining in annihilation, but something, and only, of its own arises (entsteht)

HDG.TC.content: annihilation affects the human, not humans > “the human is annihilated”: the essence of the human is annihilated > must think back to essence of human (you thinkers always think backwards)
HDG.TC.linkedContent: annihilation affects the human, not humans > “the human is annihilated”: the essence of the human is annihilated > must think back to essence of human (you thinkers always think backwards)

HDG.EC.content: because devastation is deeper, comes from farther away, our thoughts return to it again and again > the devastation of earth, the annihilation (Vernichtung) of human essence: evil itself (das Böse selbst) > evil not as the morally bad, the reprehensible, but as malice (Bösartige)
HDG.EC.linkedContent: because devastation is deeper, comes from farther away, our thoughts return to it again and again > the devastation of earth, the annihilation (Vernichtung) of human essence: evil itself (das Böse selbst) > evil not as the morally bad, the reprehensible, but as malice (Bösartige)

HDG.EC.content: a-nihilation (Ver-nichtung): In das Nichten des eigensten, verborgenen Wesens aufgehen lassen, d.h. in die Vergessenheit des Seins in der Gestalt der Anmassung seiner Einwirkung in der Vergegenständlichung [annihilation is absorption in nihilating of one’s essence, forgetting of Being]
HDG.EC.linkedContent: a-nihilation (Ver-nichtung): In das Nichten des eigensten, verborgenen Wesens aufgehen lassen, d.h. in die Vergessenheit des Seins in der Gestalt der Anmassung seiner Einwirkung in der Vergegenständlichung [annihilation is absorption in nihilating of one’s essence, forgetting of Being]
